essentials
Class RobotController

java.lang.Object
  essentials.RobotController
All Implemented Interfaces:
ObstacleListener
public class RobotController
extends java.lang.Object
implements ObstacleListener

This class is the equivalent of a Mapper or a C3PO. It controls the robot by coordinating messages that come in to the bluetooth communicator with actions that must be performed by the navigator or the locator. It also listens to the touch detector so that it can tell the robot to back up when it hits something.

Author:
nate.kb

Method Detail

updateMessage

public void updateMessage(Message m)
Puts the given message in the robot controller's inbox. For any messages besides STOP, they will be read FIFO. A STOP message will clear the controller's inbox and its current path, as well as telling the navigator to stop.

Parameters:
m - the message to be put in the inbox

go

public void go()
Upon execution of this command, the robot controller will begin listening to its inbox for new messages, executing and removing messages as they come in.

objectFound

public void objectFound(PolarPoint obstacleLocation)
Description copied from interface: ObstacleListener
This method will be called when the obstacle detector finds an obstacle, whether through a touch sensor or an ultrasonic sensor.

Specified by:
objectFound in interface ObstacleListener
Parameters:
obstacleLocation - the location of the object in polar coordinates
